definition:
Given base $b$, a number of the form $({{b^n - 1} \over {b - 1}})^2$ for
$n > 0$ (that is, the square of a repunit) is a [*Demlo number*]{},
sometimes called a [*wonderful Demlo number*]{}.

The Demlo numbers for $n < b$ are also palindromic numbers, and
specifically of the form
$$nb^{n - 1} + \sum_{i = 1}^{n - 1} (ib^{2n - i} + ib^{i - 1}),$$ that
is, the most significant digits are the first $n$ digits of base $b$ in
order and the least significant digits are the first $n$ digits of base
$b$ backwards.
